items.name: Bosque Sagrado de Tulemne
items.short_description: A hidden ancient grove revered by indigenous communities as a place of profound spiritual connection and ancestral whispers. Its ancient trees are believed to hold the spirits of forest guardians.
items.address: End of Calle Principal, near Reserva Biológica Cerro Nara, Quepos, Puntarenas Province, Costa Rica

items.name: Santuario de las Urnas Doradas
items.short_description: This secluded shrine protects ancient ceramic urns, believed to contain the ashes of pre-Columbian chiefs. It serves as a sacred space for remembering ancestors and seeking wisdom.
items.address: Camino a Playa Espadilla Norte, off Route 618, Quepos, Puntarenas Province, Costa Rica

items.name: La Piedra del Oráculo de Quepos
items.short_description: A massive volcanic rock formation, said to have been used by ancient shamans for divination. Visitors often leave offerings and meditate, hoping for insight into their future.
items.address: Near Río Savegre, Ruta 235, Quepos, Puntarenas Province, Costa Rica

items.name: Las Fumarolas Ancestrales de Manuel Antonio
items.short_description: While not an active volcano, this geothermal area features ancient fumaroles believed to be portals to the underworld. Indigenous lore speaks of spirits communicating through the rising steam.
items.address: Within Manuel Antonio National Park boundaries (requires park entry), Quepos, Puntarenas Province, Costa Rica
